means: 改正，矫正( rectify的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: The trouble with City is that they do not have enough quality players. Well, that can easily be rectified.
sentence.Network_cn: 曼城队的难题在于他们缺乏优秀球员。不过，这种情况很容易改变。

sentence.Network_en: I am hopeful this misunderstanding will be rectified very quickly.
sentence.Network_cn: 我相信这个误会将很快得到纠正。

sentence.Network_en: That mistake could have been rectified within 28 days.
sentence.Network_cn: 那个错误原本可以在28天内得以纠正。

entry.def: If you rectify something that is wrong, you change it so that it becomes correct or satisfactory.

example.ex: Only an act of Congress could rectify the situation...
example.tran: 只有国会法案才能矫正这种形势。

example.ex: That mistake could have been rectified within 28 days.
example.tran: 那个错误原本可以在28天内得以纠正。
